attributes.action: allow government time in the House of Commons to be used for an urgent motion on "no confidence" in the Speaker, Michael Martin
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Speaker, Michael Martin, is Chair of the House of Commons Commission which has overseen the abuse of the allowances system. On 11 May he abused his position in the chair to criticise MPs who had spoken out against the abuse, and has therefore lost the confidence of many of the general public.

The Speaker is elected by the Commons, not by the government, but the government controls the allocation of Parliamentary time. It is therefore within the Prime Minister's power to allocate time for a debate on Michael Martin's future as Speaker

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
